intro: Berghausia emodi, commonly known as the Himalayan snowbean, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in cold, mountainous environments and is adapted to low temperatures and poor soil conditions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an important species for ecological studies in alpine regions.
